title: End of Title 42 changes calculus of migrants at U.S.-Mexico border
description: Migrants are struggling to reevaluate and navigate the U.S. immigration system after Title 42 was lifted.

title: Canada to require health warnings on individual cigarettes
description: Beginning next year, cigarettes will bear labels including “TOBACCO HARMS CHILDREN,” “POISON IN EVERY PUFF” and “SMOKING CAUSES IMPOTENCE.”

title: Kosovo Prime Minister Kurti on recent violence and his rebuke from Washington
description: Kosovo Prime Minister Albin Kurti said in an interview with The Washington Post that statements by Secretary of State Antony Blinken had been "harmful."

title: Border towns in western Russia report heavy shelling and rocket fire
description: One town's governor said at least two people had been wounded in the attacks on Shebekino. He blamed the shelling on Ukraine, but Kyiv has denied any direct involvement in the attacks on Russia’s territory.

title: Royal wedding fever grips the Middle East: Meet Jordan’s bride and groom
description: The couple is often described as the Middle East's Will and Kate. The British royals are attending the wedding, along with Jill Biden.

title: It’s Pride Month. Here’s how LGBTQ rights fared around the world this year.
description: Countries from the United States to Uganda have passed legislation targeting gay and transgender rights since Pride Month last year.

title: China gives Elon Musk a hero’s welcome — and a message for the U.S.
description: The mercurial head of Tesla and Twitter, on his first visit to China in three years, said China and the U.S. were “conjoined twins” with inseparable interests.

title: Iran plans to escalate attacks against U.S. troops in Syria, documents show
description: Documents show new push by Moscow, Tehran and Damascus to oust U.S. forces from Syria, including through lethal explosive attacks.

title: Biden shows growing appetite to cross Putin’s red lines
description: Despite warnings that arming Ukraine will start a world war, President Biden continues to push Vladimir Putin’s limits — a strategy that brings risk and reward.

title: As missiles exploded over Kyiv, they raced for a shelter. It was locked.
description: The Ukrainian military said it intercepted 10 missiles fired by Russia at Kyiv, but three people, including a child, were killed when debris crashed down.

title: Strapped for cash? You can pay this pizza restaurant when you’re dead.
description: New Zealand’s Hell Pizza is allowing customers to pay for a pizza after they have died through a codicil to their wills.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russian strike on Kyiv kills 3, including a child; fresh shelling in Russia’s west
description: Kyiv officials said that air defenses destroyed the missiles and that falling debris caused the casualties and damage.

title: LGBTQ groups celebrate Latvia electing E.U.’s first openly gay president
description: The selection of Foreign Minister Edgars Rinkevics, an outspoken supporter of Ukraine, underscores the divide between Russia and the country it once occupied.

title: High-profile Australian soldier loses ‘war crimes’ defamation case
description: The case pitted Ben Roberts-Smith, a towering war hero, against three Australian newspapers, and at times turned into a de facto war crimes trial.
